solution_line_template: When fishers caught {westward_fraction_caught} of the fish that swam westward, their total number reduced by {westward_fraction_caught} * {initial_westward_fish} fish = <<{westward_fraction_caught}*{initial_westward_fish}={westward_fish_caught}>>{westward_fish_caught}

The total number of fish that remained from the total number that swam eastward is {initial_westward_fish} fish - {westward_fish_caught} fish = <<{initial_westward_fish}-{westward_fish_caught}={remaining_westward_fish}>>{remaining_westward_fish} fish

If fishers caught {eastward_fraction_caught} of the fish that swam eastward, their total number reduced by {eastward_fraction_caught} * {initial_eastward_fish} fish = <<{eastward_fraction_caught}*{initial_eastward_fish}={eastward_fish_caught}>>{eastward_fish_caught} fish

{initial_eastward_fish} fish - {eastward_fish_caught} fish = <<{initial_eastward_fish}-{eastward_fish_caught}={remaining_eastward_fish}>>{remaining_eastward_fish} fish remained in the sea from the number that swam westward.

The total number of fish in the sea after fishers caught some is {initial_north_fish} of the number that went north + {remaining_westward_fish} of the fish that swam westward + {remaining_eastward_fish} of the fish that swam eastward = <<{initial_north_fish}+{remaining_westward_fish}+{remaining_eastward_fish}={total_remaining_fish}>>{total_remaining_fish} fish
